entry.title: Deploy MERN App On Heroku
entry.summary: What is the use of your app if other people can‚Äôt use it? Deployment makes our application live for the use of world. MERN stack i.e. MongoDB, Express, React and Node is the most popular stack for developing web applications and Heroku is the cloud PaaS (Platform as a Service). Now what the hell is PaaS? Well Platform as a Service means that Heroku gives a platform where we can deploy, manage and scale our application in the form of cloud service. We don‚Äôt need to take stress of production server and its operations. We can build our app and connects our code to the Heroku and the rest of the work will be done by Heroku only. There are many platforms in the market where we can deploy our application but they charge money. Now I personally want free things and Heroku is free to use and we ca‚Ä¶

entry.title: Brave Shortcut and Ubuntu Application
entry.summary:
Hi Everyone, I'm Choose css-tricks.com for example
To Doing this, first, on the top and left of view, click the hamburger menu and go to More tools > Create Shortcut...
Brave, show you a prompt, then, enter your custom name for application and Check the open as window
application dekstop file exists on ~/Desktop/ directory by brave-{ANY_NAME}.desktop file name
Move the brave-{ANY_NAME}.desktop file into ~/.local/share/applications/ path by Terminal or GUI $ mv brave-{ANY_NAME}.desktop ~/.local/share/applications/brave-css-tricks.desktop
Then, You can change replace any name to instead 'css-tricks' because this make it readable open nano in Terminal and update Exec= and Icon= property $ nano ~/.local/share/application/brave-css-tricks.desktop
on the nano editor, change the Exec= property to brave as launcher (alike below screenshot)
on the nano editor, change Icon= to correct path (alike screenshot) NOTE : you should change {USERNAME} to your exactly username /home/your-username
you can copy the {APP_ID} from the Exec= property
9. Enjoy! :)

entry.title: Ethical source movement, or how to try to fight the evil corporation to use your code
entry.summary:
source :
This post was made on stack overflow blog by David Gray Widder is a PhD Student in Software Engineering at Carnegie Mellon, and has studied challenges software engineers face related to trust and ethics in AI at NASA, Microsoft Research, and Intel Labs. You can follow his work or share what you thought about this article on Twitter at @davidthewid.https://twitter.com/davidthewid I found the article interesting enough to share it. I received it via stack overflow newsletter. https://stackoverflow.blog/newsletter/ The Ethical Source Movement seeks to use software licenses and other tools to give developers ‚Äúthe freedom and agency to ensure that our work is being used for social good and in service of human rights.‚Äù This view emphasizes the rights of developers to have a say in what the fruits of their labor are used for over the rights of any user to use the software for anything. There are a myriad of different licenses: some prohibit software from being used by companies that overwork developers in violation of labor laws, while others prohibit uses that violate human rights or help extract fossil fuels... I cannot say more without copy pasting the article which would be wrong. Free and open-source software licenses remove your ability to control what others do with your code. That‚Äôs kind of the point. It‚Äôs also why they‚Äôre so popular: anyone can use, remix, and sell your code into new technological possibilities with little restriction! What could go wrong? Read it on the author blog.

entry.title: Why C Programming is The Best For Beginners
entry.summary: C is a general-purpose programming language. C has been used to write everything from operating systems to complex programs like the python interpreter, git, oracle database, and more. C is used in many PC games. It has been used to code some tasks for different small games and big games. So, learning C can be beneficial if you are interested in building a career in game development. In this article, I‚Äôm gonna tell you why C programming is the best for beginners. C used in embedded programming used to control micro-controllers. These micro-controllers are used in robotics, computers, and automation. Learning C can help you here too. Read More: How to Learn Programming With Mobile? Why do we tell beginners to start their programming career with C programming or why beginners should learn C ‚Ä¶

entry.title: What's your favorite screenshot tool on Linux?
entry.summary:
What's your favorite screenshot tool on Linux? AmyJune Hineline Sat, 08/20/2022 - 03:00
Register or Login to like Register or Login to like As the saying goes, a picture is worth a thousand words, and while that's not always the case with terminal commands and code, it still holds true for the graphical desktop. Screenshots capture precisely what's on your screen. I love taking them to have a record of who attends meetings, so I don't have to write it down at the moment. Or to capture a bug when doing UI testing. We all take them for different reasons, though, and there are more ways to take a screenshot than you might at first think. I started thinking about screenshots after Jim Hall wrote an article listing GNOME screenshots, GIMP, and Firefox as the ways he often takes screenshot‚Ä¶

entry.title: 60 Days of Data Science and Machine Learning
entry.summary: Hello, everyone. Following are first 2 weeks of this series. You can find them on my github repository. You can run all the notebook on colab or jupyter as well. Day 1 - Python Basics Part1 Topic : Data Types, Strings, Operators, Chaining Comparison Operators with Logical Operators Day 2 - Python Basics Part2 Topic : Python Lists and Dictionaries, Sets, Tuples and etc Day 3 - Python Basics Part3 Topic : Loop, Break and Continue Statement, Object-Oriented Programming and Class Day 4 - Intermediate Python Part1 Topic : First Class Function, Private variables, Global and Non Local variables, Magic Function, Tuple Unpacking, Static Variables and Method Day 5 - Intermediate Python Part2 Topic : Lambda function, Matic methods, Inheritance and Polymorphism, Erros and Exception Handling, User-defined function, Python garbage collection, and debugger Day 6 - Advanced Python Topic : Decorators, Memoization using Decorators, Generators, Ordered and Defaultdict, Coroutine Day 7 - Statistics for Data Science and Machine Learning Topic : Statistics for Data Science Day 8 - Maths for Data Science and Machine Learning Topic : Linear Algebra, Calculus, Matrix and Vectors, Bayes Theorem and Cheatsheets Day 9 - Pandas Part1 Topic : Pandas Series, DataFrame Day 10 - Pandas Part2 Topic : Indexing, Filtering, Transformation, Merging, Hierarchial Indexing Day 11 - Numpy Topic : Flattening, Concatenation and Broadcasting Day 12 - Data PreProcessing Part1 Topic : Encoding categorical data, Split data, Feature Scaling Day 13 - Data PreProcessing Part2 Topic : Data Cleaning, Data Augmentation, Transformatoin, Channel Shift Day 14 - Regression Part1 Topic : Simple Linear Regression, Multi Linear Regression, Polynomial Regression Hope my work would be little bit helpful for AI enthusiastic. https://dev.to/thunderstroke https://github.com/thunderstroke325 Best Regards.

entry.title: How to create an app with GetX architect in Flutter.
entry.summary: In today's article, I am going to share the steps for how to create the Flutter app with GetX architect. Let's start. GetX is a lightweight and powerful solution for Flutter. The solution combines high-speed state management with intelligent dependency injection, as well as route management. If Flutter is already a framework then why should you choose a micro-framework(GetX) for cross-app development in Flutter? So here are some benefits that GetX is providing. Performance GetX provides high performance and minimum consumption of resources. GetX does not use Streams or ChangeNotifier. Decoupling Business logic is separated from UI, and even dependencies can be separated using GetX Bindings. Internationalization GetX provides i18n out of the box allowing you to write applications with v‚Ä¶

entry.summary:
I‚Äôm not sure Elmo will be happy to learn about the episodes that were pulled. | Image: Sesame Workshop
In potentially devastating news for kids and parents, about 200 episodes of Sesame Street have been removed from HBO Max, Variety reports. Many of the dropped episodes are from the show‚Äôs earliest seasons, and the number of Sesame Street episodes on the service has fallen from around 650 to 456, according to Variety. HBO and Sesame Street have been connected for years; WarnerMedia (now Warner Bros. Discovery) locked in a big five-year deal in 2019 to exclusively stream new episodes of the show, and Sesame Street first began airing on HBO in 2016. ‚ÄúSesame Street is and has always been an important part of television culture and a crown jewel of our preschool offering,‚Äù HBO Max spokesperson Chris Willard said in a statement to The Verge.... Wayfair saw a spike in sales at the beginning of the pandemic as customers stayed home and took an interest in renovating their space and shopping online but today announced it‚Äôs laying off 870 employees. In a filing to the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), the online furniture and home decor retailer indicated that the ‚Äúworkforce reduction‚Äù affects 5 percent of its global workforce and 10 percent of its corporate team. In the company‚Äôs second-quarter results released on August 4th, Wayfair reported a decrease in active customers, orders per customer, order deliveries, and a slight decrease in orders delivered via Wayfair‚Äôs mobile app and in other areas. entry.title: This site exposes the creepy things in-app browsers from TikTok and Instagram might track
entry.summary:
Using in-app browsers could give easy access to your private information. | Photo by Amelia Holowaty Krales / The Verge
Did you know you‚Äôre potentially being tracked when you load an in-app browser on iOS? A new tool reveals exactly how, showing how applications like TikTok and Instagram can potentially use JavaScript to view sensitive data, including your address, passwords and credit card information, without your consent. The tool can be found at InAppBrowser.com. All you need to do is open the app you want to check and share the InAppBrowser.com URL somewhere within it ‚Äî such as DMing the link to a friend or posting it in a comment. From there, you can tap the link and get a report from the website on what scripts are running in the background. All you need to do is open the app you want to check, and share the InAppBrowser.com URL somewhere within it Continue reading‚Ä¶

entry.title: My journey with Kubernetes
entry.summary:
My journey with Kubernetes Mike Dame Fri, 08/19/2022 - 03:00
1 reader likes this 1 reader likes this Recently, I published my first book, The Kubernetes Operator Framework Book from Packt Publishing. Writing a book has always been a personal goal of mine, and so it seems fitting that I was able to check that off by writing about one of my favorite topics: Kubernetes. My journey with Kubernetes began in 2016, as a software engineer for Red Hat OpenShift. There, I had the opportunity to work with (and learn from) some of the smartest folks in the open source community. I learned first-hand some of the best practices for Kubernetes development as they were applied to broad enterprise use cases. And as I watched the development of OpenShift 4 take shape, I got to witness the functionalit‚Ä¶

entry.title: App Screenshot Generator ‚Äî A 100% free tool for creating app store screenshots
entry.summary:
https://progressier.com), I've made our app screenshot designer tool a standalone product available to anyone who needs it, free of charge.
There are many alternatives for creating screenshots for the app stores. However, I thought it would be cool to make one that: - anyone can use without signing up - has mockups of recent phones - works on mobile - doesn't lock features behind paywalls - renders screenshots without watermarks - is completely free
It's optimized specifically for creating PWA screenshots (you can enter a URL and it'll screenshot it for you). But you could also use it for generating screenshots for the App Store, Google Play, or even Product Hunt.
If you have any questions, please let me know! ‚Äù

entry.title: Open source runs on non-code contributions
entry.summary:
Open source runs on non-code contributions John E. Picozzi Thu, 08/18/2022 - 03:00
2 readers like this 2 readers like this At this year's DrupalCon North America, EPAM Solution Architect John Picozzi presented a talk about the importance of non-code contribution. He talked about how everyone can get involved and why he believes this is an important topic. This article is a text adaptation of John's talk; find a link below to a video recording of the complete presentation at DrupalCon. What is non-code contribution? I asked Google this question and got the following answer: "Any contribution that helps an open source project that does not involve writing code." Thanks, Google, but I already figured that out. If you asked me to dig deeper, I'd say it's about providing your time, skills‚Ä¶

entry.title: Tability for Clickup ‚Äî Bring your OKRs and goals to Clickup
entry.summary:
What's Tability?
I'm glad you ask! Our job is simple: to help teams stay focused on their goals. We built Tability because there were many great project management platform (like Clickup) but not a lot of options for goal-tracking. So we decided to tackle that issue to create a platform that is: - Intuitive and pleasant to use - Outcome-centric - Built for focus
Now, we just had to find a way to link our goals back to your work. And this is what this integration is doing!
Your OKRs ü§ù your tasks
With our new Clickup integration you get the benefits of having the best of everything: ‚úì an easy way to manage your OKRs in Tability. ‚úì a great way to view progress on projects in Clickup. ‚úì a simple way to link outcomes to outputs.
Sign up for Tability here ‚Üí https://www.tability.io ‚Äù

entry.title: snoopForms ‚Äî The open-source Typeform alternative, and much more
entry.summary:
half the deal.
Handling submission data gets really messy really fast. Add a large number of different forms and big, multi-disciplinary teams to the mix and you get... chaos üëº
Matti made this experience a few times building form and data management solutions for clients. He kept looking, and looking, and looking for a versatile, self-hostable solution built with a modern stack - until he decided to build one himself.
Because it's no fun alone, he hit me up with the idea for an open-source Typeform (but actually it's much more ü§ì).
We put our heads together and started building. Today, we are more than happy to share with a bigger audience what we have built so far üéâ
üíæ Data First snoopForms puts data at it's center. Forms are only the starting point of an interaction and a comprehe‚Ä¶

entry.title: Measure latency for embedded systems with this open source tool
entry.summary:
Measure latency for embedded systems with this open source tool Nicolas Rabault Wed, 08/17/2022 - 03:00
3 readers like this 3 readers like this When it comes to time synchronization for embedded systems in a distributed architecture, there are "soft" use cases (typical, everyday devices) and complex, or "hard," use cases (car brake systems, aerospace). It's easy to see that a hard use case has unique requirements and a low tolerance for latency. To put it another way, hard use cases have hard, real-time constraints. Latency is the bitter enemy of real-time computation. Latency, in the context of a critical real-time application, is the time between data generation and data reception. The reality is that when there is an interconnected network of several systems, there's latency. [ Re‚Ä¶

entry.title: 4 common issues with implementing Agile and how to address them
entry.summary:
4 common issues with implementing Agile and how to address them Kelsea Zhang Wed, 08/17/2022 - 03:00
3 readers like this 3 readers like this While working on the open source ZenTao project, I get constant feedback that getting Agile up and running is a big task in many organizations. As with any new process, you will run into issues, and many of them will feel unique to your organization. While context is important, there's a certain amount of abstraction possible after you've coached enough teams. This article covers the four most common issues I've encountered. While your Agile coach should analyze any actual problems in the context of your organization, knowing these general issues can help better prepare you and your teams for the transitional process. Note that I only discuss is‚Ä¶

entry.title: Formify ‚Äî Create, manage and embed forms on static sites with no code
entry.summary:
https://formify.vercel.app/ Github: https://github.com/Basharath/For... npm package: https://www.npmjs.com/package/fo...
ùóúùó±ùó≤ùóÆ ùó≥ùóºùóø ùòÅùóµùó≤ ùóΩùóøùóºùó±ùòÇùó∞ùòÅ: I often create different projects in the form of websites and often those sites will be static or client-side rendered.
Having a contact form on static sites through third-party services involves a bit of extra work and sometimes could be cumbersome. I often ignore adding contact or feedback forms on most of my sites to avoid the hassle of setting forms.
So I thought if there's a free tool that lets me embed contact forms on any number of sites without writing code and just in a few steps, it would be great!
That's where this ùëìùóàùóãùóÜùóÇùñøùóí idea came to me.
ùóôùòÇùòÅùòÇùóøùó≤ ùòÇùóΩùó±ùóÆùòÅùó≤ùòÄ: 1. Ability to add different emails for different forms to receive notification 2. Enhance the form script and add multiple color themes for users to select. 3. Email notification toggler for each form
Hope this formify application will be helpful to all those who want to add contact forms to their sites without much hassle. üí´
Please share your views/feedback about this product.
Thank you for stopping by üôè ‚Äù

entry.title: My practical advice for new programmers
entry.summary:
My practical advice for new programmers Sachin Samal Tue, 08/16/2022 - 03:00
3 readers like this 3 readers like this Have you ever been stuck or gone blank trying to solve a problem related to something that you just learned from YouTube or Google tutorials? You seem to understand every line of the code, but without the tutorial, you find yourself in a difficult position. If you have looked at problem-solving in HackerRank or LeetCode, you can relate to how an aspiring programmer feels seeing those challenges for the first time. Everything seems out of the box! Being unable to apply what you learned from a tutorial might make you doubt your knowledge and abilities as you begin to understand the basics of the programming language you're learning. Putting programming tutorials into pra‚Ä¶

entry.title: A look inside an EPUB file
entry.summary:
A look inside an EPUB file Jim Hall Tue, 08/16/2022 - 03:00
2 readers like this 2 readers like this eBooks provide a great way to read books, magazines, and other content on the go. Readers can enjoy eBooks to pass the time during long flights and train rides. The most popular eBook file format is the EPUB file, short for "electronic publication." EPUB files are supported across a variety of eReaders and are effectively the standard for eBook publication today. The EPUB file format is an open standard based on XHTML for content and XML for metadata, contained in a zip file archive. And because everything is based on open standards, we can use common tools to create or examine EPUB files. Let's explore an EPUB file to learn more about it. A guide to tips and tricks for C programming, ‚Ä¶

entry.title: Try AsciiDoc instead of Markdown
entry.summary:
Try AsciiDoc instead of Markdown Seth Kenlon Mon, 08/15/2022 - 03:00
4 readers like this 4 readers like this I'm a happy user of the XML-based Docbook markup language. To me, it's a precise, explicit, and detailed system that allows me to have contextual and domain-specific metadata in what I write. Best of all, though, it can be transformed (that's what XML users call it when XML is converted into another format) into nearly any format, including HTML, EPUB, FO for PDF, plain text, and more. With great power comes a lot of typing, though, and sometimes Docbook feels like it's surplus to requirements. Luckily, there's AsciiDoc, a system of writing plain text with the same markup-less feel of Markdown, but that transforms to Docbook to take advantage of its precision and flexibility. ‚Ä¶

entry.title: How ODT files are structured
entry.summary:
How ODT files are structured Jim Hall Mon, 08/15/2022 - 03:00
2 readers like this 2 readers like this Word processing files used to be closed, proprietary formats. In some older word processors, the document file was essentially a memory dump from the word processor. While this made for faster loading of the document into the word processor, it also made the document file format an opaque mess. Around 2005, the Organization for the Advancement of Structured Information Standards (OASIS) group defined an open format for office documents of all types, the Open Document Format for Office Applications (ODF). You may also see ODF referred to as simply "OpenDocument Format" because it is an open standard based on the OpenOffice.org's XML file specification. ODF includes several file types,‚Ä¶
